Posts.Content: Hi Freewheeling I had a Mastectomy & reconstruction with an implant last Oct. I was warned it might fail as I had Radiotherapy to that breast 16 years ago. Anyhow I had to try....all looked really good to begin with. I was elated with the result, but in January I developed an infection & the implant was removed. I was devastated at the time, but now I have got used to it & just put my jelly booby in my bra. I keep getting offered different reconstructions, but my Consultant said there is no guarantee it will work & 2 failures can be very traumatic. I think the decision is personal & everyone is different. Good luck Lisab xx
Posts.Title: failed deep flap

Posts.Content: Hi Jilly  I had a mastectomy & reconstruction with a silicon implant. The result looked fantastic, but one small end of the wound would not heal & this resulted in me having a major infection & emergency surgery to remove the implant 6 weeks ago. To say I was devastated is an understatement. I hated what I looked like, but six weeks on I have a prothesis & I am really happy with it. The lady who came to fit it was superb. We tried different shapes, sizes until the match was perfect. It fits snug inside my bra from Peacocks (without a pocket) & as time goes on my scar/flat chest is looking so much better. It's horrible just after surgery, but it does get better Lisab xx
Posts.Title: failed deep flap

Posts.Content: Hello all you ladies on this thread. This topic is really of interest to me too as I am 4 weeks post op & due to see the Oncologist in 2 weeks. I had 2 tumours - one very close to the skin, but both HER -. Can anyone please tell m what the difference is between HER - & HER + please? Many thanks Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Oncotype results and should I have chemo?

Posts.Content: Sorry Lynn I'm getting muddled with who I'm replying to lol. Thank you for this. It's such a hard decision for me & the more info I have will make it easier I hope you are doing well Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Oncotype results and should I have chemo?

Posts.Content: Good for you Carolyn. I had a Thyroid issue before all this kicked off & found it really useful to have access to my results. I researched what I didn't understand & I'm getting to grips with my BC results by reading these reports too. It's easy to forget what you have been told in Consultations. Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Oncotype results and should I have chemo?

Posts.Content: Candytop - There are some beautiful sentiments in there. You have reminded me, get a grip you can do this!!! I wish you the very best my lovely Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Oncotype results and should I have chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi Candytop, I was alerted to your post I think because I was in a dilema as to whether have Chemo or not a few weeks ago. It is a hard decision to make, but I have opted not to have Chemo. This was based on something the nurse said at my meeting. She said they had high risk patients who had refused Chemo & they had been fine & low risk patients who had Chemo & it had returned. It's hard to predict how each individual is going to react to treatment & but it has benefited a lot of people. I was lucky my results were good in my opinion. Had I had lymph node involvement I may have made another decision, but for now whether right or wrong (time will tell) I have declined.   I think the decision must come from what you think is best for you. I have had friends who have agreed with my decision & some who think I've lost the plot ha! Good luck Lisab xxx
Posts.Title: Oncotype results and should I have chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi Julia That last bit should have read lumpectomy/radiotherapy in 2000 Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Oncotype results and should I have chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi Suzie Did you know that you are allowed access to your medical record?  The site is called Patient Access. You will need your surgery's ue code & you add your username.  You can read your notes at your leisure Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Oncotype results and should I have chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi all, I have recently had a mastectomy & reconstruction & have been advised to wear a soft bra, but on my discharge notes it says support bra. Can someone help as to what I should be wearing please. Many thanks Lisab x
Posts.Title: Which bra after surgery?

Posts.Content: Hi Nicky Bless you having to go to your appointments by train. That's very brave! Did you have both breasts done? That must have been so painful! I only had my left breast removed as it was a recurrence from 16 years ago. They also found another lump that was not picked up near the skins surface - so I have to talk to the Oncologist about Chemo which has knocked me back a bit. I know what you are saying about the drain. My god what a difference & you had 2? Hats off to you lady! Keep smiling. Anyone willing to make a train journey after all that is made of strong stuff. Lisabxxxx
Posts.Title: Which bra after surgery?

Posts.Content: Thank you lovely xx
Posts.Title: Which bra after surgery?

Posts.Content: Hi Terri Do you mind if I ask how much Chemo you have to have? I am still waiting for my onco appt to come through. My first BC was 16 years ago, treated with lumpectomy & radiotherapy. I'm wondering whether had I had Chemo then it would have stopped this recurrence. I suppose everyone is different & goes through a different senario, but equally distressing Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Which bra after surgery?

Posts.Content: I think it was probably coz I'm quite small busted &  they maybe thought it wasn't too much of an issue? The consultant did put support bra on my discharge notes, but I never gave it a thought until yesterday what I should be wearing. Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Which bra after surgery?

Posts.Content: Hi I had a silicon implant. Thank you for response. You have answered a few of my queries recently lovely - thanks again xx
Posts.Title: Which bra after surgery?

Posts.Content: Thank you Terri. That must have been comforting to talk to a 30 year survivor! Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Which bra after surgery?

Posts.Content: Oh my goodness half of that is gobbledy gook to me. I think you are right. I need to get educated on some this. Hugs to you too Terri. I really hope all goes well for you Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Which bra after surgery?

Posts.Content: No I wasn't given anything from the hospital, just told to wear a soft bra. It wasn't until I got home that I thought OMG what does that mean lol. I have ordered a coupled of non wired support bras from my catalogue xxxx
Posts.Title: Which bra after surgery?

Posts.Content: Hi Nicky All the chemo info still sounds like another language lol. I'm sure I'll have a better understanding of it all when I've seen the Oncologist. Your mum had done so well! That must be encouraging for you. My first tumour was only grade 1 so that makes sense I didn't have to have Chemo then. I'm so glad your Oncologist is lovely. You deserve the best. You truly are one brave lady. Thanks for your response again. Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Which bra after surgery?

Posts.Content: Thank you Nicky.  I'm just over 2 weeks post op. What did you have - a Silicon implant? I hope you're feeling well Lisab xxx
Posts.Title: Which bra after surgery?

Posts.Content: Hi Nicky I still can't believe you got on a train with two drains. Bless your heart! Did you have Lymph nodes taken from under your arm? I have found this the most painful. I had some taken the first time round so this time they had to scrape right into the armpit to get more. I have found if I massage moisturiser into my shoulder/upper arm before bed this helps & vaseline on the under arm scar as it's very tight. The only thing I do with the breast scar is gently wash it at the min. I can only have showers as we live in a Bungalow with just a shower cubicle, but oh how lovely it was to shower after 10 days so I can understand a bath must have been heaven. How did you get on with Chemo & how much did you have to have? Sorry I'm clueless on all of this ha! I'm not too bad today thank you (hope you are having a good day). I'm normally an optimistic/happy person, but this has knocked me sideways, but onwards & upwards. We will get there I'm sure Lisab
Posts.Title: Which bra after surgery?

Posts.Content: Thank you so much ladies. I'm so glad I joined this site. Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Which bra after surgery?

Posts.Content: Carolyn, It is so refreshing to find someone who is on my wavelength!!! The reason it's been suggested is because my tumours are a recurrence from 16 years ago. I feel I would be putting myself through more stuff that might not necessarily be needed & like you say it's dangerous. If I had lymph node involvement I might have considered it. Thank you for your input. I hope you are feeling good today Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Hi Julia Thank you for your response.  This is such a hard decision. Have you had Chemo? Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Sorry Julia I think I responded to this on the wrong post. I understand PCr now - thank you. I think you ladies are so very brave. Thank you so much for sharing your experiences with me Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Are you having a check up next Fri Carolyn? Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Lol Hope all goes well. Thanks again for all your support today Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: We are in the middle of an acquisiton & for confidentiality reasons I can't say too much, but the company is not English & have been very good to me. Liquid biopsies wow! Thank goodness we have been diagnosed now & not 30 years ago Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Was that painful Avril? Hats off to you for having another go. I took Tamoxifen for 4 years for my first BC. I'm going to be on Letrozole this time & I did start taking it, but had to stop as I had a small wound infection. This is almost healed so will have another go soon Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Hi Avril Thank you for your response. Did the Chemo affect your implants at all? I'm really quite proud of my implant & that's another factor in my decision. LIsab xx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Sorry Julia I think I responded to this on the wrong post. I understand PCr now - thank you. I think you ladies are so very brave. Thank you so much for sharing your experiences with me Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn Thank you for your response. I have read a lot of your posts. You are very informative & I can see why - bless you!!! It seems the harder the journey the more information that person supplies. I'm 58 & my first tumour was treated with a lumpectomy & 4 weeks radiotherapy & for 16 years I thought that was it! 18 months ago I lost nearly 2 stone & was diagnosed with an overactive thyroid. This stabilised 3 months ago once I came off the medication. None of my tumours have shown on Mammograms I have found them by sheer luck - being small busted helps ha! What do you do for a living naughty clients! Are you working whilst receiving treatment? Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Ha ha, I know what you mean about sunnier climes. I love hot weather & function much better in the summer! Are you self employed? I work as a Payroll administrator. At present we have 6,000 employees with another 2,000 shortly. It is stressful on payday, but I have been off since September. My surgery was mid Oct. I'm waiting for my check up with my surgeon in Jan before I go back to work & it will be a phased return. I'm even considering permanent part time. but I wouldn't want to be off work 18 months. You are very good supporting people now you are through the worst. That's really kind of you Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Hello ladies I hope you are all having a good day. I'm after some thoughts on Chemo please. I have had a mastectomy & silicon implant reconstruction with excellent results. I had two 5mm tumours grade 2 HER- Oestrogen positive with 6 clear lymph nodes. One of the tumours was near the skins surface. I am agonising as to whether I should have Chemo or not. I will be taking Letrozole too. I know this is my decision, but would appreciate any feedback  on this Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Hi Londonlass That is exactly my take on it & as you say I could have it further down the line. I have gone with my gut instinct all along on this & at the moment Chemo just doesn't feel right. Most people are very supportive of my decision, but some look at me as if I've lost the plot ha! Thank you for your input & like Carolyn I hope you are having a good day Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: It was classed as a recurrence, but was in different places? My surgeon said that they may not recommend Chemo as you are on hormone therapy, but go and have a chat anyhow. You are right, I need to go with what feels right xx Thank you Julia, Carolyn & Londonlass you have been very informative/supportive. Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Hi Avril Thank you for your response. Did the Chemo affect your implants at all? I'm really quite proud of my implant & that's another factor in my decision. LIsab xx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Ah yes I understand it now. Bless ya! Some of you ladies have really been through it. Like the others I think you are really kind to offer support now you are feeling better & I think you all are so so brave Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Are you having a check up next Fri Carolyn? Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Hi Londonlass He said I was borderline anyhow, but because it was a recurrence he has to recommend Chemo. The nurse said she had seen patients who were high risk who refused Chemo & had been ok & had also seen low risk patients who have Chemo for it to return. I really don't want it unless it is absolutely necessary. Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Hi Julia Yours is an encouraging story. Does pathological complete response mean you didn't have any problems during chemo & your cancer responded well  during treatment? I'd half made up my mind when I came out of the Oncologists office, but I still have a week to make the decision. I've gone with my gut instinct all along & at the moment it's saying wait. Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Lol this is excellent Carolyn  LIsab xx
Posts.Title: Home after op ........

Posts.Content: Hello Barfy So glad you are home. I hope all went well. I had the same as you in Oct & I have only just started to hoover. I would say at this stage do as little as possible. Everyone is different, but while you're resting you are healing. Do your arm excercises gently. I was able to do light dusting after a couple of weeks, but my surgery was on the left side & I'm right handed. I'm sure the other ladies will agree, don't push yourself yet Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Home after op ........

Posts.Content: Ah yes I understand it now. Bless ya! Some of you ladies have really been through it. Like the others I think you are really kind to offer support now you are feeling better & I think you all are so so brave Lisabxx

Posts.Content: Was that painful Avril? Hats off to you for having another go. I took Tamoxifen for 4 years for my first BC. I'm going to be on Letrozole this time & I did start taking it, but had to stop as I had a small wound infection. This is almost healed so will have another go soon Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: That's encouraging that you didn't have to have lymph nodes taken. My drain site wound took a bit of healing too. I was advised to keep a dressing on it until it scabbed over & I couldn't shower until this happened. Maybe your GP might be able to help you on this. It;s distressing when things don't go to plan. I hope you are feeling better today. Lisabxx
Posts.Title: The long wait.

Posts.Content: Hi Chick.36 I am 4 weeks post op for mastectomy & reconstruction & all I can say is it does get easier. Just take each day at a time. The first couple of weeks are the worst because everything is so uncomfortable.  I found Co codamol a godsend. Did you have lymph nodes taken? If so keep doing your excercises.  I hope you feel better soon Lisab xx
Posts.Title: The long wait.

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy Can I ask how you are getting on with the Letrozole please? I have just started to take this & wondered how long it was before the benefits/side effects kick in. TIA Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Curious.....

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy Can I ask how you are getting on with the Letrozole please? I have just started to take this & wondered how long it was before the benefits/side effects kick in. TIA Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Curious.....

Posts.Content: Hi Bougiecat Thank you for coming back to me on this. It was very helpful. I've only been on Letrozole for a few days & I'm thinking this isn't so bad. Common sense should have told me it would be a while before the side effects start lol! I hope you slept well last night & have a good day today Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Curious.....

Posts.Content: Hi Bougiecat Thank you for coming back to me on this. It was very helpful. I've only been on Letrozole for a few days & I'm thinking this isn't so bad. Posts.Title: Curious.....

Posts.Content: :) xx
Posts.Title: Curious.....

Posts.Content: :) xx
Posts.Title: Curious.....

Posts.Content: Hi Nicky Are you the lady I was talking to before Christmas? You went on the train to have your drains removed. I have been wondering how you are getting on. Barfy - I had a mastectomy & implant recon on right breast & still remember the fear leading up to it. All I can say is trust the hospital staff. Mine were brilliant & my surgeon has done an excellent job. I went in on a Weds afternoon & was allowed home the following afternoon. The first couple of weeks are a bit uncomfortable, but after that everything starts to settle down. I will be thinking of you on Weds Lisabxx
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Nicky Glad you are doing ok. I totally understand the emotional thing. I worry all the time - am I going to be ok. I'm sure this will pass in time. I had a wound infection about a month after surgery which has only just healed, but apart from that all seems ok. I'm seeing my consultant on the 21st & due back at work on the 23rd. This is making me anxious, but they have been really good & are letting me do what hours I want & I can change my contracted hours too later. I would love to retire if the truth be known, but I have 7 years to go yet. You was my hero - getting on a train with 2 drains in. You're made of strong stuff !!!! Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Nicky How did the meeting with your manager go? Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: Barfy, Thinking of you today. Lisab xxx
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Nicky You are my hero. You have been through so much. I couldn't stop thinking about you - getting on that train. I realise I am very lucky as my hospital is a 20 min drive away. I was taking Letrozole before the infection, but was told to stop this until I was healed....so I'm going to have another go this week. I took Tamoxifen for 4 years 2000-2004. So yes the senario still goes on eh! I was having anxiety attacks about going anywhere on my own, but on Saturday I got myself ready, took a deep breath & did a bit of clothes shopping. It was a good feeling to do something normal. I think the anxiety thing about work comes from all the trauma & I'm sure we are not on our own. I'm at the dentist today so that will be another hurdle lol  Lisab xxx
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Nicky How kind of you to ask how the dentist went! I just went for a check up & clean (long overdue), but it was doing something normal again. I got chatting to the dentist's assistant & she had a Mastectomy 7 years ago & is doing well, so that was a boost. I just bought some new tops & a couple of chunky cardigans for work. I want to go back to work looking refreshed ha! Yep my 1st BC was in 2000 - lumpectomy & 4 weeks radiotherapy & I coped well, but I was 16 years younger lol! How are you doing today, hope it's a good one? Lisab xx
Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday and pooping myself! !!!!
